io.nebulas.core

Class Address

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.nebulas.core.Address

  • public class Address
extends java.lang.Object
    This Address class implements Nebulas Address Design . There are two type of address: account address and contract address.

    An address has two data forms: bytes address and string address. The bytes address is an array of 26 bytes, and the string address is Base58 encode of bytes address.

    Examples of bytes address and string address:

    • bytes address: [25,87,28,9,140,12,125,159,7,158,22,96,209,211,96,26,132,247,93,227,1,195,40,228,147,89]
    • string address: "n1H56f7wTLu389iX6ufP2VkWBynindaxXvx"


    The Address class mainly handle address related tasks, such as:

    • generate new account address from account public key
    • conversion between string address and bytes address
    • get address object by parsing a given string address or bytes address

    An original address should be generated by AccountManager, as shown in the example code blow. 
     {
     byte[] passphrase = "passphrase".getBytes();    //prepare your passphrase
     AccountManager manager = new AccountManager();
     Address address = manager.newAccount(passphrase);
 }

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description

      The length of public key, which is 65.

    • Method Detail

      • bytes

        public byte[] bytes()
        Get the bytes address, which is an array of 26 bytes. Such as [25,87,28,9,140,12,125,159,7,158,22,96,209,211,96,26,132,247,93,227,1,195,40,228,147,89]
        Returns:
        the account address, which is a byte array.

      • string

        public java.lang.String string()
        Get the string address, which is calculated by encoding the address bytes array with Base58. Such as "n1H56f7wTLu389iX6ufP2VkWBynindaxXvx".
        Returns:
        the address string.

        public static Address NewContractAddress(byte[] from,
                                         byte[] nonce)
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Make a new contract address address with given address bytes and nonce.
        Parameters:
        from - the byte array of contract address
        nonce - the nonce
        Returns:
        an Address object
        Throws:

      • ParseFromString

        public static Address ParseFromString(java.lang.String addr)
                               throws java.lang.Exception
        Get the Account object from a string address.
        Parameters:
        addr - the string address of an account.
        Returns:
        the returned address object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the length of string address is not 35, or the first letter of string address is not "n"

      • ParseFromBytes

        public static Address ParseFromBytes(byte[] bytes)

        Get the Account object from a byte address.
        Parameters:
        bytes - the byte address
        Returns:
        the returned address object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the length of byte address is not 26, or the first element of byte address is not "n"
